reviews.title: Great Getaway
reviews.text: We recently stayed at The Chelsea. Our first time and definitely not our last. We booked the oceanview Penthouse Suite to celebrate our birthdays. The bedroom was so spacious and beautifully decorated. The living room facing the ocean was a great bonus room. We enjoyed watching the ocean waves and the view of the sunrise in the morning. We enjoyed a wonderful dinner at Chelsea Prime. The food was phenomenal. My husband said it was the best filet mignon he had ever had. We had exceptional service everywhere we went. Mike, the Manager at Chelsea Prime, came to the table to introduce himself and verified that all was well with dinner and we were enjoying ourselves. The hotel was super clean and spotless everywhere, even the bathroom tile shined. The check in process by Darrell and check out by Monique were both smooth and timely and both were extremely friendly and knowledgeable. Bellman Bill was also very friendly and the valet staff was efficient. The Chelsea is located right next door to the Tropicana for gaming and shopping and in the evening we walked the boards. It is only a ten minute walk to the Pier. We enjoyed a stroll on the beach in the morning after a wonderful breakfast at Tepitsky's. The stuffed french toast with fresh berries was the best!

reviews.title: 2-1/2 star dying hotel on the crumbling side of town that is more like a motel
reviews.text: We looked at other hotels and booked the Chelsea because it was unique in style and on the boardwalk. We enjoyed our visit and would highly recommend the Chelsea. Our stay there was beyond our expectations. Atlantic City looks different to us now.

reviews.title: Dust, Dust, and more Dust!
reviews.text: I can't believe this hotel is given 4 stars by price line and other sites. 4 star hotels like the updated Treasure Island in Las Vegas have beautiful lobbies lined with marble, and beautiful high end decorations. This "hotel" is showing decay and neglect. Old dirty elevator, old lobby with old furniture, nasty looking wallpaper in the hallways, and old lamps with dim lightbulbs that look like they were purchased at garage sales. In addition, the hotel is on the decaying side of town next to a larger hotel that has gone out of business and has been converted to an apartment complex.

reviews.title: hot and bothered
reviews.text: On a positive note, the rooms have clean sheets with comfortable pillows and mattresses. The bathrooms are large and clean. The employees are nice and give good service. When I look into each employee's eyes I can almost see this unspoken melancholy that they know that the hotel is quickly going out of business and they will soon be out of jobs.

reviews.title: Business trip downtime
reviews.text: While on a business trip in the Philly/Jersey area, I decided to spend one evening in Atlantic City and booked a room at The Chelsea. AC was about an hour and a half from my next day's appointments, so it was a reasonable excursion to have a nice dinner and do a little gambling in my off hours. I travel to AC a few times a year but have never stayed at a property on the boardwalk. I booked an ocean view room for $159. The hotel is just as described on its website. The decor of the lobby reminded me a bit of a W Hotel layout and styling. You have to valet park which was fine and service was prompt and attentive. Check in was smooth, but there was no orientation to the hotel's amenities. I found out independently that the bar/lounge was not open during the week and the nice meal I'd planned to have turned out to be fish and chips in the empty diner style restaurant in the motel side of the hotel. This is not a knock against my stay as its clearly mid-week and off-season and the staff was highly competent in every engagement I had with them. My room was slightly smaller than I expected and had an odd oversized floor lamp stationed in the middle of the window area which I had to move to the side of the room to have my ocean view unobstructed. The bed was very comfortable and I have to say that the room service breakfast was better than average and not over-priced. I did not use the gym, so cannot comment on it. I would recommend the Chelsea based on price and level of service. You can also walk down the boardwalk to Tropicana, Trump and Ceasar's to gamble as Chelsea has no gaming.

reviews.title: Great Staff, Great Room
reviews.text: I came up to The Chelsea last weekend to see a show at the House of Blues. Check-in with Darrell was speedy and efficient, he went over the amenities of the hotel very thoroughly and explained the "Stay & Play" package we'd booked in detail. Let me say, the price (granted, it's off-season) was very fair, especially after the $15 restaurant credit and $20 gaming credit. Teplitzky's restaurant with a diner atmosphere was delicious and reasonably priced. Our server Melissa was extremely attentive and friendly, and made no move to rush us out after we'd finished our meal and were sipping coffee. I really appreciated that.

reviews.title: Very nice hotel
reviews.text: Having called down several times over the course of the weekend Marvella and Monique were both very accomodating in answering my questions about the hotel, and in person even more so.

reviews.title: Luxe it is not, but you get what you pay for
reviews.text: I will say I was disappointed with the fitness center, only having one treadmill, one eliptical, and a rack of free weights; also the water station was bone dry. However, they have a sweet clover-shaped hot tub that I thought was pretty great which made up for the sub-par fitness center. Parking was very reasonably priced, and Joseph(?) the valet when I checked in was very clear about payment and options for the parking.

reviews.title: Why is this place a 4 star??
reviews.text: The room was really nice; it was spacious and clean and well-stocked. I especially liked the set-up of the bathrooms, all stone and glass. The "ocean view" was a bit lacking, at least for the corner room, but all in all I'll be sure to go back. As a hotel concierge myself I rated the service to be excellent, and the rooms to be at least 3.5 stars.

While on business travel this past week, I decided to spend an evening in AC and opted for a repeat stay at the Chelsea to have some ocean view time while in town. After a full day of work and travel, I arrived early evening ( after 6pm), checked my car with the valet and proceeded into the lobby. Ahead of me were three young women checking in together using a coupon rate. There was some confusion about applying the discount and they were engaging with the desk clerk, Brandi. Next to Brandi was a young man named Raymond who appeared to be doing nothing. I waited nearly 15 minutes without any interaction or acknowledgement from anyone behind the desk or even from another older Chelsea employee in the lobby in a suit
reviews.title: a hit and miss return to The Chelsea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ( the manager maybe?) who stood NEXT to me to direct Raymond to call a bellman for another guest and then disappeared. I am a very patient and easy going traveler, but the length of this wait without the simple courtesy of "I'll be right with you...", or "we'll be a few minutes, have a seat..." or even a nod of "one minute" grated on me. To have two people manning the front desk, but only one can actually perform check-in duties is both confusing and annoying. How would they handle a line of five or ten people? Maybe this was an anomaly, but I found my annoyance with the management for poor training procedures rather than with the two employees.
reviews.title: Sold out? Skip the Chelsea!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was as expected; a king with an ocean view. It was clean, comfortable, but the a/c is noisy. I also did not enjoy the rain-drop style faucet in the shower, but only because I prefer a stinging spray of water. I had dinner at the Chelsea Prime later in the evening and very much enjoyed the 1940s lounge decor and the sharp, friendly staff. I texted my wife to tell her I felt like I was in the Cotton Club. I wanted to come back later in the evening to see what the night life would be like, but never made back that night. I had breakfast the next morning in the diner past the Annex. It was very good and reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Wonderful spa area

reviews.text: My check- out was the complete opposite of check-in. Fast, efficient, and an expression of gratitude for my choosing the Chelsea over the many other AC options.
reviews.title: One night only

reviews.text: I am not a 100% soured on staying at the Chelsea, but only because its location is great for waking up to the sun over the beach and ocean and for taking a morning stroll with a coffee on the boardwalk. But then you can do that at most of the casino properties and probably not pay for your room if you earn any comp.
reviews.title: Great stay will recommend the Chelsea Luxe Tower!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I planned a weekend away for my husband and picked the Chelsea because it sounded very quaint. It was cute, but the service was less than I would have expected. Except for in the Chelsea Prime restaurant, they were lovely, but the prices were way over the top for the portions. The hotel room was a nice size, but the bathroom alone, was enough to make me never stay here again. There was no counter to put ANYTHING on and the shower was the worst I have ever experienced. The pool area was small and so crowded you could not get a seat. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Weekend Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at The Chelsea for a wedding. The ceremony and the reception were held at the hotel. The facilities used could not have been better. The reception was held in their dining room overlooking the ocean. The food was exceptional and what impressed us most was the Hotel waitstaff. The attention to detail, their concern for proper service and their pride in the Hotel was evident.
reviews.title: Great Two Nights on the Boardwalk

reviews.text: Our room was large, well furnished and most important had a very comfortable bed. The only negative comment we have is, there was no coffee maker in the room.
reviews.title: Wonderful Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We liked the fact that The Chelsea doesn't have a Casino, it was a little more relaxing. The Tropicana is right next door so excitement is only a few steps away.
reviews.title: Memorial Day/Birthday Weekend at the Chelsea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the time we arrived the very professional and friendly staff made us feel most welcome.
reviews.title: Chelsea Hotel - Atlantic City
Great AC hotel.
reviews.text: Love this hotel. They don't Nickle and dime you on everything. Decent food and great customer service. Rooms are real nice too.

reviews.title: Pretty good
reviews.text: I stayed here last April for two nights. It was one of the only Atlantic City hotels without any bed bug reports! There is no casino, but I was there for business and it didn't matter. It's also convenient to many of the casino hotels. The room was pretty clean. I did check the mattress for any indication of bed bugs and found none.

reviews.title: Parker
reviews.text: I wouldn't call this a deluxe or luxury hotel but the room was decent, the lobby was decent and the staff was polite.

reviews.title: It used to be much better
reviews.text: One beautiful over night stay, booked online receved an ocean front room, king size bed, valet people were very nice and helpful. Walked in early at Front Desk people very nice (Dana) she put me right into my room. This hotel gave complimentary beach chairs and unbrella that was put up where I wanted. Hotel was in a nice location. I'm planning on going back real soon and told all my friends.

reviews.title: AC Just Wants You To Have a Good Time
reviews.text: We stayed at the Chelsea back when it opened and loved everything about it. Things have gone down hill over the past few years. The rooms are noticably worn, and they've discontinued the Kiehl's hair products in the bathrooms :( And, the customer service was horrible. We asked for beach chairs on the beach and were told that they would be waiting for us. When we got to the beach, there were no chairs. We called the front desk and were told someone would assist us. We called again 15 minutes later and were told someone was on their way. No one ever came. While it's still a nicer hotel, it's no where near as nice as it was when it first opened.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This seems to be a very popular location for the twenty something crowd who want to have fun and who have good taste. Although we are in our fiftys we felt at home and a little inspired. The hotel had the insight to locate us on the 19th floor which was away from the intense action on the fifth floor and we appreciated that. Our room had a wonderful view of the ocean and we were directly over the pool. The accomodations were very nice except for the air conditioning system that was very loud. All of the staff were very accomodating and professional. The hotel is in a perfect location and the beach accomodations were a nice touch. I would certainly return and sorry I missed the groupon offer. Hope they have another.
reviews.title: Hanging with the young crowd.

reviews.text: I'm a local, so I've stayed at most of the casinos' hotels in AC. A group of girlfriends and I were going to a concert at Borgata on Memorial Day Wknd but didn't want to pay Memorial Day Wknd prices, so we reserved a room at The Chelsea's Annex using one of their email codes (I think it was the "All In" package?) Anyway, for $110, we got a double full bed room in the Annex, $25 gaming credit, shopping coupons, $30 food credit at the diner, and a rickshaw ride. The only thing we honestly used was the food credit for breakfast the following morning at the diner, which was awesome. We also ate a quick dinner at the poolside restaurant, which was also really good.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem in AC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was a basic hotel room, nothing fancy, but totally adequate for what we needed - a place to get ready for the night out and a place to crash! We came back after the concert and went to the club, which is free admission for hotel guests. We had a blast there!
reviews.title: Great time at the Chelsea!!

reviews.text: The thing that struck me the most about The Chelsea was the pleasant attitudes of the staff, their willingness to answer questions & help you out, and their amazing customer service - those traits, in and of themselves, warrant a return trip... and the price is great, too.
reviews.title: It only takes one person to ruin a good time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Wife and I stayed there on Memorial Day Weekend for Our Anniversary!! We had a Great Time The Chelsea is aWonderful place to stay. Their staff and accomadations were AWESOME!!!
reviews.title: Fun visit to the Chelsea!

reviews.text: I often read negative reviews on this site and feel like they are written by bitter people, the type of person that keeps sending back soup in a deli.
reviews.title: Hotel has gone down hill!!!
Good but not Great
reviews.text: I stayed at the Chelsea back in January and I thought it was one the best hotels I have every stayed at. The service was amazing the room was great and I had no complaints. Unfortunately my recent trip has prompted me to write this bad review. So hear it goes,

reviews.text: Pulled up to the valet dropped off the car and got in line to check in. The line was long but I only had to wait a few min, no big deal. I had booked a room in the Annex building and as I checked in I was told the rooms in that building are, "not nice" and I can upgrade to the tower for $25, so I did.
reviews.title: PHENOMENAL SERVICE AT A PHENOMENAL HOTEL!! LOVE LOVE LOVE!!

reviews.text: Lunch...
reviews.title: Really Disappointed This Time Around
Great Alternative to Casino Hotels
reviews.text: My wife and I have stayed here several times over the past few years and always had a good experience. We always stay in the tower instead of the annex. I'd imagine there is nothing wrong with the annex, but we prefer to be on a high floor with a view of the ocean.

reviews.title: Cool Hotel!!!
reviews.text: The night club is usually pretty good and hotel guests usually get in for free or pay a discounted cover charge. I could see there being an issue with noise if your room is directly above the club. We always request a high floor so we never had an issue.

reviews.title: Awesome two night-stay
reviews.text: The hotel steakhouse, Chelsea Prime, is excellent and offers nice ocean views. Never had a bad meal there. It's not cheap, but you get what you pay for. Teplitzky's is a great change of pace for breakfast, lunch, or dinner and they have an excellent happy hour. They used to have rickshaws, maybe they still do. I haven't seen them the last few times we were there. The beach service is a huge plus and it's included in your room rate.

reviews.title: on the boardwalk having some fun
reviews.text: I am not a fan of the hotel pool area. It's too small and about 50% of the space is cornered off as cabanas that you have to rent. And this story tops it off...We went there the morning we were checking in to lay out and relax before our room was ready. I got a call that the room was ready around 1pm, so we went up to check-in and unpack. About an hour later we came down to find out we had to pay $20 per person to go back to the pool since it was some special DJ party. I explained I was a guest, already had 2 chairs, and $100 tab running. They did not care. So i got escorted by a bouncer into the pool area to gather my belongings and pay my tab. I thought that was ridiculous, but that was my only bad experience in 3 years. I'd avoid the pool in the future and just go to the beach.

reviews.title: Not a 4 star property
reviews.text: We will certainly be coming back the next time we are in AC.

Overall the hotel and room were beautiful. The beds and pillows are super comfy and the decor is modern, warm and inviting. I was disappointed by the lack of ethnic diversity among the hotel guests and the all-night partying. You don't really stay at this hotel for R&R as there is an all-night pool party that gets ridiculously crowded and you can hear the music from the hotel rooms. The elevators are super slow and the phone was busy every time we called the front desk for anything. I would only recommend the hotel if you're looking to party all the time. I'm in my mid 20s and was looking to have a good time but was annoyed by the obnoxious drunk guys who couldn't hold their liquor.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel but much to be desired

reviews.text: So, I stayed here for two nights over the weekend. This is a nice, new hotel with a nice feeling since it is a boutique hotel - NO casino on site but it is right hear the Tropicana Hotel and Casino.
reviews.title: COOL LITTLE HOTEL .......BIG ATTITUDE .....

reviews.text: I stayed in the "annex" part of the building which wasn't very nice. The beds were nice and the room had a mini bar but the annex building is really a turn-off. The elevators going to the room floors are GROSS - management needs to fix this as guests deserve better. The bathrooms in the annex are very small, not well lit and have limited space and amenities.
reviews.title: Expensive, ridiculouly loud, hotel is only for 20 something singles

reviews.text: There is a nightclub on the 5th floor of the main tower and while I liked it please note, the music could be heard in my room on the 4th floor of the annex. Also, this club brings many people into the main lobby of the hotel waiting for elevators to get up to the nightclub - I only say this because for some you may not be interested in waiting a long time just to get up to your room while others are looking to party.
reviews.title: Horrible Pool Service & Slow Elevators!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are two pools - one a little more quiet on the main floor near the spa and the other is a rooftop pool which has nice lounge chairs, waiter service,cabanas , and a bar with a DJ at least on weekends. The 5th floor pool is really a "scene" with everyone showing off a bit so keep in mind if you are just looking to relax and have some quiet time.
reviews.title: Loved It!!!!
A Gem in Atlantic City
reviews.text: We just got back from an overnight at the Chelsea. We arrived on a Monday and had a fantastic stay in this very posh AC hotel. If you're looking for trendy and elegant, you will not be disappointed. This hotel is far better than any AC casino hotel I've stayed. If you like the idea of being in AC but do not want to stay at a casino, this hotel is for you. The valet parking was a surprise and it was the same price to park here as it is to self park in the AC casinos. Check in was a breeze, and even though we arrived a couple hours before the check in time, they took care of us and found two rooms. We stayed on the Luxe side of the hotel. The pool is the BEST in Atlantic City. Take a look at the photos on their website, they speak volumes for the atmosphere at the 5th floor pool. The pool service was also excellent. The chaises were ready to go with terry-cloth covers and towels for headrests. Unlike other reviews, the pool was fully staffed, on a Monday, the bar had ample mixers and the staff couldn't have been more accommodating. If you're looking for great pool food, you will not be disappointed. The burgers were outstanding and don't forget to try the Maryland fries! We played pool in the Game Room and had very potent drinks at the Chelsea Prime bar. Hey, if you're paying $10 for a drink, it better be good and these drinks did not disappoint. The Oysters Rockefeller at the bar were also quite enjoyable. Our room was clean and I have to mention how comfortable the beds are. If you like a great bed and nice linens, you'll have a great night's sleep here. With the comfortable bed and room darkening drapes, we even slept in. The breakfast at Teplitzky's was a treat. You can eat on the diner side or the very cool open air side. The food was great and Diana, our waitress, was excellent. I hope you're future stay here is as enjoyable as mine.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Chelsea, Atlantic City - I found a really great deal thru Expedia for a king bed in the Luxe Tower for $200 the day before since we didn’t feel like driving back to Philly after a friend's birthday party. The hotel itself was cute and trendy and had a very cool retro vibe. We checked in late (2:30am) and had no problem with the valet or the front desk finding our reservation. What was a problem was the girl at the front desk told us about the Club on the 5th floor and said she was trying to find us a room on the higher floors because of the noise, once she hands us our room key she tells us our room is on the 5th floor - I then asked "uh you couldn't find anything higher up?" to that she just said "no, that's all that is available." I wasn’t about to challenge that at 2:30am so we go to the 5th floor to which the elevator open to a nightclub, totally confused we interrupt a bouncer in the process of kicking some guy out "where are the rooms?" There are no rooms on the 5th floor, we show him our room keys and he tells us our room is the on 18th floor. Now we both swear up and down she told us that our room was on the 5th floor, not that big of a deal just a hassle and annoying. Once we got to our room it was adorable, clean, and had an amazing mini bar with beer, wine, sodas, and snacks - oh and a price list for it all which you don't see very often. The bed was very comfortable and because we were so tired the throbbing cheesy club music didn't really bother us, but even on the 18th floor we could hear it - loudly. I was also woken up by what I assume was a hotel worker whistling in the hallway at 6am for what seemed like an hour. Checkout was very easy, I just called the front desk to let them know and our car was brought around quickly. Overall not too bad of a stay. The hotel is very hip and interesting but lacking in the functionality department, we are really easy going so we overlooked the noise but I know most wouldn't.
reviews.title: Cute, trendy, but not quiet...

reviews.text: Believe the negative reviews that you read - they are all true. I stayed with two friends for a weekend getaway the weekend of July 17 - 19, 2009. We decided to book the Chelsea based on what we saw on the website and considering it's a relatively new hotel. We thought we would be staying at a boutique-y hotel that would provide great service considering the size.
reviews.title: Not even a 2 Star Hotel. This place is a scam.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First off, it's not a new hotel - it's a renovated motel. The building is old and that's clear by all the areas they skimped out on fixing. The inside of the hotel looks like a Trading Spaces re-do, where they had a vision to make it look modern, but the cutting corners and seemingly low budget to execute the vision allows you to see that they only made modest cosmetic changes.
reviews.title: Very Good ! 4.5 stars

reviews.text: Now, the stay - check in was bad . We waited 2 hours past check in time to get our room because it was apparently "under inspection." I'm not sure what they were "inspecting" because when we got to the room, there were only towels for two people (we were three) and enough amenties for one.
reviews.title: My Bachorlate Party at the Chelsea
Had a nice one night stay
reviews.text: We stayed for one Friday night here and were very happy. It has been redecorated beautifully and it is on the Boardwalk and very close to the Trop. so we didn't mind that it is not a casino hotel. We arrived hungry and tired and Kevin at the front desk checked us in quickly. The restaurant Teplitzky's was so convenient and had good food, we were glad it was so handy. As the day went on it got quite crowded in the lobby with a pretty young looking crowd waiting to be checked it. So if you can arrive early. The room and bed were very comfortable and the bathroom sparkling. The only complaint I have is that the air conditioning must be the original from when it was a Holiday Inn. It worked just fine but made a real racket whenever it switched on. But the free Internet is a wonderful perk. PS The Chelsea lite behind the Chelsea looked a little scary, I would avoid it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just stayed at The Chelsea for the second time this year. The first time I stayed was in February and the second time was in July. The second time was even better than the first because it was summer and both pools and spa were open. The beach was also wonderful with the complimentary beach chairs and umbrellas. All of the staff were friendly and accommodating. But one individual stood out in her service and that was Monique at the front desk. She was extremely professional and went above and beyond to ensure that my stay was enjoyable. She upgraded my room both times I stayed to ocean view rooms. She even called my room to ensure that I was happy with my accommodations. I was very impressed with her exceptional standard of service. I will definitely be returning to The Chelsea. The only complaint I had was the service received at the pool bar on the 5th floor. The bartender's service was ok early in the afternoon when it wasn't busy. But later when a small after work crowd arrived around 6pm I was ignored for almost 15 minutes. I left the bar without being served after having already spent $75 on drinks earlier and went elsewhere. If not for the poor service at the pool bar I would have given The Chelsea an excellent five star rating.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Extremely unfriendly and rude front desk staff, concierge and manager.
reviews.title: Never Stay Here

reviews.text: I left a dress in the room - was told they found it and it would be mailed. It was never mailed. I called for three weeks - and no one would give me a straight answer and no one would call me back.
reviews.title: AWESOME HOTEL

reviews.text: I will NEVER return to this hotel and will tell everyone I know to NEVER stay there.
reviews.title: More focused on pool party than service…

reviews.text: Charming hotel, friendly staff. The beds are so comfy.
reviews.title: Hotel Gem

reviews.text: I have stayed here before and I found the food at Tepletzky's to be vastly improved.
reviews.title: Clean, affordable option in Atlantic city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am looking forward to coming back.
reviews.title: Great Place for a Wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Chelsea is a great, more modern option to some of the bedbug infested casinos in Atlantic City. It is at the far end of the boardwalk, but an easy walk to most casinos on the boardwalk.
reviews.title: Everything but the housekeeping..

reviews.text: We did have a few room issues including our first room not having been yet serviced from the previous guest and then our second room having a wet rug and unclean bed linens, but the reception desk was quick to upgrade us to a better room and provide us with meal vouchers both times, which was a sign of good service. This hotel also has 2 great pools for the summer months.
reviews.title: Purple fever!!!
